The portion was a bit small but still very cute.
Great ambience and interesting drinks. The Bird's Nest was very enjoyable, I liked the lollipop on top- it actually tasted like birds nest. Great place to chat with friends.

I accidentally left a review on the wrong account (connected to my email not facebook) so leaving another lol. My favorite place ever, you are always kindly greeted by staff who also give you your food very quickly. The pasta is incredibly fresh, delicious, the best. It's less than $20, which is unheard of in NYC. I always look forward to going here. My goal is to go at least once a week. Everything is perfect. Love the new fort greene location with beautiful outdoor section. My favorites are the pipette ragu and spaghetti pomodoro. Love the panna cotta as well, classic and delicious. Everything is 12/10, infinity/10, always have an amazing experience, please try this place if you appreciate beautiful pasta. In addition to affordable pasta they give you free focaccia with your order. What's not to like.

Great location, service, and quality. Fun area to walk around in and very easy to get walk-in seating on a Saturday when we went. Lots of menu options and all so high quality, fast, and tasty. So glad I discovered this spot. Side salad and cauliflower tasty too. Pastas were awesome

Just go. Don't even think, just go. There's no way you're leaving this spot unsatisfied. They put must put fairy dust in the food because this was the most magical meal I've had in so long. Plus the staff was so nice, we had several restricted diet questions and they were so kind answering even when they were in the middle of the rush and checked on us several times to make sure we enjoyed everything. Cute and intimate interior, but the real prize has to be the back patio which will be so lovely in the summer. So yes, just go you won't regret it.
Food was great ! Best device in town. Very cute space. I'm from CALI and this was for sure bussin

Everytime i take anyone new here, they always say it's even better than i hyped it up to be. For the price, the quality is insaneeeee. The service at this location was so amazing. I love and recommend this place to everyone. The food is made fresh and some of the best pasta i've ever had everytime.

I'm thrilled for this second location of my favorite pasta in New York! The food is all as reliably delicious as ever--super fresh pasta, delicious sauces, fantastic sides, suuuuuper good focaccia... it's so nice to be able to get all this goodness further south in Brooklyn  and the back yard is particularly nice! A really lovely spot to spend the evening with a wine and maybe a cheeky dessert

5  for the hospitality. Seriously everyone was so kind and helpful. The food is offered at a very affordable price and it was yummy! My favorite was the cauliflower dish. Free bread is always a plus. Would recommend 100x. Interior is also clean and bright.
This place is great the food is a good amount. The person who rang us up was very polite, the coffee was really good also. Overall great experience, will definitely be back!!

Went last week and had an incredible meal here for a fraction of what it would cost to get the same pasta at a fancy restaurant. Everything is so fresh (all of their pasta is made in-house) and just tastes soooo good. You literally can't go wrong with whatever you order but I especially love their pappardelle bolognese. So happy to have this amazing, affordable, ridiculously delicious pasta option in the neighborhood.
So glad they opened a forma here. Every pasta dish I've tried had been delicious. Favs are the shrimp scampi and Ragu. Comes with free bread. Fast service. Clean cozy space. Love the open kitchen.
Place is neat! friendly staff. They offer brunch Saturday and sundays! A must try Pork Skewers and their new item Pork sisig!

Came here last weekend for a birthday party! We were in a private room called the "board room" and there were a lot of options for brunch; I almost couldn't decide. They do have bottomless drinks for $27 which is a bit expensive imo but there are a lot of options of cocktails to try. I would recommend not getting the mimosas, this is the first mimosa I've had with ice in it  the waitress was great and checked in on us, the drinks and food took a little while, but that's as expected with a big group. They have an interesting selection of beers too, as a bonus.

Went here for brunch, no complaints. It was a good place, nothing special. Online it said they had no reservations so I called to reserve a table and when we got there, we were the only ones in the entire restaurant (and service was still slow), so not a fan of that. But the food was good. Like I said, nothing special, but not bad by any means.
Came here for an office holiday lunch. We were a group of 7 and were seated by the windows. Everyone got their own dishes - and there were just raves all around. Their zucchini fries were delicious.

Definitely a decent option for after work happy hour drinks or dinner, was easy to get a table, service was quick, inside is very spacious unlike some other FiDi happy hour options. Thought it was a bit pricey but really enjoyed my tacos!

I love it here! They also have another location as well, smaller but love it too! Happy hour is a must, they have beer, wine, cocktails and food! Bartenders are usually pretty good. Again, I love it here!

I'm so glad I found this place by asking locals walking around what's open that has food and music. When I sat at the bar downstairs, I was greeted by Elizabeth and Victoria. These ladies were super awesome. From food recommendations and stirring up amazing old fashioned's I was extremely happy with letting them choose for me. The cheese curds!!! Just wow. The look and feel though a Halloween setting at this time, is exactly the way I want a whiskey bar to feel like. I'll be back here while I'm on my trip

20/10 !!! This precious gem DESERVES more love for brunch like ok seriously. I am upset that this spot is overshadowed by the French brunch place next door. We were just looking for a spontaneous brunch place near Oculus, and stumbled upon this spot and seriously seriously was blown away. The whole menu looks great for brunch - had something for everyone I would say, but both my bf and I were eyeing the breakfast burrito and you can see from the pic how crazy big it is. And the taste was heavely - scrambled egg were fluffy and hot, the greens were awesome, potatoes were amazing. Still dreaming about these burritos whenever I want to have brunch now!

Great happy hour until the bartender definitely lied and claimed she was "out" of a cocktail. How are you out of a cocktail that isn't batched? Just say you don't want to serve happy hour prices. Lol. Beyond that, I really enjoyed the food and drinks but stopping happy hour early? That's just tacky.
The food service and interior decor of the malt house was very nice. I would return again!
best wings in Fidi for sure! the Brussels and nachos are a hit too! Absolutely love the staff, very welcoming! Definitely a vibe!

Very mediocre. Trufflely pasta was ok. Wings were large but ok too. Very commercial place that's big on bark, no bite. Service was excellent.

It was a great find for a group brunch that also has a bottomless option. Super easy to get to the location and the menu accommodated a bunch of different dietary restrictions. That said, the food was purely ok. Between our group, we pretty much ordered everything on the brunch menu. I'm not sure I would go back unless I was stuck without a venue that could seat a group. I'm fairly certain there's always space there.
We were in a group of 10 people and everybody raved about the service and food! Fun place! Definitely recommend!
This was an work spot that I used to go to pre-covid.  They have a great happy hour and some great wings.  The wings and chicken bites were my go to when I worked in the area.

I came here for a lunch date and it was ok. The food was good very fresh. The service was slow which it something to keep in mind if you are coming here for lunch and only have one hour. The waitress was very nice and helpful. I ate the lobster bisque for an appetizer and main course I had the salmon po boy. My date had the shrimp appetizer which was very good. The lobster bisque had a tart taste which was unexpected and had pieces of lobster in it. The salmon po boy was interesting it was more of a salmon burger which the waitress did inform me of. It tasted fresh and flavorful. I did enjoy this place and would be back for happy hour. The frozen machine was not working so I could not taste the frozen drinks.

Couldn't find any negatives (not that I was looking for any) - very very solid meal. Turkey sliders were good and the buffalo chicken was enjoyable. It can be a little loud and tables are a little small for eating though.

Very very loud. Food and drink were good but a bit overpriced even for the area. It has a pretty, warm, wood aesthetics and fresh flowers on every table. It seems like a good place for happy hour but I would skip if you want to have a conversation.

I was looking for a late dinner in the Financial District, and this is one of the few places still open after 10pm on a Sunday. Staff was very friendly, and the interior is more upscale than your typical sports bar. In terms of the food, my party ordered the salmon, the pasta, and the turkey BLTA. I say this with any bar that I visit -- don't expect bars/pubs to make great dinner entrees. I often find that bars don't do the best job preparing actual restaurant dishes such as salmon and pasta. Stick to the simpler things like the turkey BLAT or even a burger. You can't go wrong with those. Would come back again though if I find myself in the Financial District at a late hour again.
Food is excellent, service is great and its convenient.  We love it here since it's right across the street from our hotel.

Casual place that seems to always have open seats. The bar has a good selection of beers (bottled and on tap) and whiskeys (apparently one of the largest in NYC). Their happy hour specials are great but end pretty early at 6 pm. The food here is decent though not spectacular. There are definitely better options in the area. I mainly come here because it's convenient and don't want to wait to be seated.

Sorry for the terrible photo of this yummy vegan kale Caesar salad! At least it's helpful to see the size of it lol. I was glad to see they finally had something vegan on the menu. Their fries are good and the salad was also good (just a few croutons, not a lot of dressing) but nothing spectacular. The kale was good! Not too crunchy and tough. Service is always great here and the place is clean. I took off two stars for the lack of vegetarian or vegan options. It's a pub/bar more than anything but it would be nice to have one entree that doesn't have meat. I'm used to making do with side menu items. Nice spot for lunch on a weekday. We had a group of 8 at 12:15pm and no reservation on a Wednesday, they accommodated us.
Nice place and good atmosphere. I think it's an afterwork happy hour kinda place.  They had good happy hour specials and the food was very good bar food.  I would go again.

I work in sales and come to New York about 2x per month. Each time I love wandering around my hotel and finding a new restaurant to try. I found myself wanting a good salmon dish around 8-9pm but a lot of the typical recommendations were closing. I stumbled upon The Malt House as I was looking for dinner because of the curb appeal. There are big windows to give a sneak peak of what's inside. I am SO happy I decided to stop because their Scottish salmon dish was to die for. I chose a sour to drink but they have plenty of beer and a full bar. A nice elegant environment that is also the opposite of stuffy. A huge vibe. 10/10 recommend and would come again.

We were staying in a hotel that was very close.  We went during Happy Hour and had an appetizer and shared a meal. The food was excellent.  Service was also very good. The pub was very busy.  The only downside was the noise level.

Stopped in real quick after a lash appointment. Had a couple drinks on happy hour and the chicken bites . The chicken bites had absolutely no seasoning unfortunately and no amount of sauce helped it lol . BUT service was good everyone was friendly and the drinks were good.

Nice pub setting with indoor and outdoor seating. Good selection of beers. We were between meals so our group of five shared some apps (nachos with chicken, nachos with beef, Mac and cheese, and caprese). The nachos were really good and filling. The others were ok but the nachos were the stars of the show. Friendly staff that kept drinks full and apps coming. Recommend giving them a try.
I would recommend the Mahi Mahi tacos, pulled pork sliders, and the special of the day when we went, beef tacos :)

The Malt House was one of the best brunches I've had in a while - the bottomless drinks were incredible and the service was quick so my cup never emptied. The croque madam was a unique and delicious choice for brunch and was popular amongst my group. Would definitely recommend!

Love love love The Malt House! Amazing selection of draft beers and everything I eat there is always delicious. I had the wings and cheese curds last night. I've had the nachos and chicken bites before also- amazing!!! Can't wait to go back.

Came here for happy hour with a new friend. Their happy hour menu is pretty good, has some beers, cocktails and house wines in addition to some food items. I would definitely come back for more happy hours. They also have big TVs so people can watch games.

I don't think I would come here again.

Perfect spot for last minute brunch on a Sunday. I got the Croque Madame + bottomless mimosas-  both were great and worth it. :)

Last time I was hear they didn't have a lot of whiskey available. But COVID has made things rough so I reserve judgement. This review is for the food. Burgers are surprisingly good. Juicy and well seasoned. Beats the burgers at fancy steakhouses nearby like Reserve Cut for a fraction of the cost. I'd definitely go here if you're in FiDi looking for a very good burger.
We had a party of 11 here a few weeks ago for brunch. They did not disappoint!! The food was spectacular and you can't beat their bottomless brunch pricing in Manhattan.

I love this place! Their cocktails are always delicious. The buffalo chicken sandwich is incredible! They also have zucchini fries that are amazing! I love coming here!

Absolutely loved the bar. Plenty of space between guests, delicious drinks and food & clean premises. It was the perfect romantic vibes for my date & I, but there were other groups there (girlfriends catching up, other dates, happy hour goers). This place does happy hour from 3-6P, and I had the frozen margaritas, which were strong. The bartender was the star....he was fantastic. Unfortunately, I didn't ask for his name but he was there Tuesday (12/8 for happy hour). I loved his friendliness, kindness and fun attitude...really makes me want to come back. There were about 10-15 people and singlehandedly he cared for everyone. Can't wait to come back!!

There are so many good places in the neighbourhood with which you can frequent instead of the Malt House--why go to an establishment that treats its one accessible bathroom stall as a storage unit, when there are so many options in the village? The Leroy House, for one; even the Half Pint, for another. The manager's attitude with which to regard the situation was atrocious and thoughtless; please, grab your drink elsewhere. Missirizzi has a fantastic happy hour, every day, from 4-7. Boucherie and Petite Boucherie are right nearby, as is L'Artusi. Spend your money at an establishment that is inclusive of all of its patrons.

I had a great time at this place, as a first time visitor. This place has a wonderful brunch/lunch options, and the boozy drinks ar strong, and of good quality. I had the chicken and waffles, with bacon. So GOOD. Also special shout to Giovanni, he delivered exceptional service to us. I was sad his shift ended before I said thank you.

Very nice place with friendly bartenders. I sat at the bar and ate. It was a little busy at about 7pm, but there were tables still open and no reservation was needed. Try the Wisconsin Cheese Curds!

One of my go to brunch spots. They have amazing prices for the food and drinks you get during their bottomless brunch deal. Generous portion of food and delicious! The drinks are super tasty and the service is amazing too. Never had a bad experience here and I'll definitely be back!

Good food, cool setup from the high ceiling to the metal pillar design touches, pleasant staff, huge non generic beer menu and decent prices (considering it's Manhattan) it's worth a visit.

We went here for happy hour on Friday. Our experience was very pleasant and I will return when I am in this area. We got there a little after 4pm and the bar quickly filled up. We enjoyed the wings and rosemary fries. My mom had the MH mule for $8, which was very good, and I had the Bluepoint toasted lager for $6. The non-happy hour beers I found to be very over priced $11 for Sloop which is brewed here in NY.

Great happy hour. I had the wings, mac & cheese, and popcorn chicken. I went with a few other people for drinks. It was awesome

They weren't spicy at all and they came with a creamy green aioli type of dipping sauce . I also ordered rosemary fries and they were freshly made and fried . I ended up drinking two glasses of Pinot Grigio because it was too tasty just to have one . I will be coming here again .

My husband and I found this place when we decided to go out for a stroll and a bite to eat at 11pm. This place was close to where we were staying at so we walked there. It had a nice ambience with dimmed lights and candles. We got seated right away and I got the cajun chicken sliders and my husband got the BLT. With cidar and a melbec. The waitress was nice and the food was so good! After dinner we moved over to the bar at the restaurant. It was nice we will go back! :-)

Good selection of beer. Cocktails are meh. I would stick to the beer. The bar is spacious, nicely decorated with good lighting. As for the food, the fried cheese curds are damn good. Plenty in portion, not pricey for quality and quantity. Cheesy, ooey, gooey YUM
This feels like a cheap knock off of the other malt house, Greenwich Village is superior in every way.

You know what kinds of happy hours I hate? The kind that ends at 6pm. I work almost across the street and its still a hustle to get over here for a drink before it ends. Every time i've tried to even check out the place, its been packed beyond belief. In the sense that good luck on trying to even find room to get up to the bar to order a drink because bros by the dozens are raging with their popped collars tonight. An additional thing that is crumby, I know there is a second location in the west village. I've actually been there as well and its better. Why? Because everything on the menu is about $1-2 cheaper and their happy hour actually runs till 7pm. I don't really get it because I never saw anything special about fidi. Also, putting drinks in wee little mason jars pisses me off sometimes when I want a proper pint. The only reason why this is 3 stars instead of two is because I've had their west village location's cheese curds (same menu) and they are divine. Also, the fact that food is included on the happy hour menu - awesome. I just wish the two restaurants weren't so vastly different because of their neighborhoods. I've been actually able to get a seat and breathe at the other spot instead of dealing with bros.

My stopped in for some drinks, a snack, and to catch some college football. They have a bunch of TVs throughout the bar so you can catch the big game from anywhere in the beer. The beer menu has a bunch of craft options including some local offerings from Grimm, Other Half, and Barrier. If you're not local, then this bar gives a great opportunity to sample some of the best local breweries. We decided to offer some chicken bites with our drinks. I would opt for something different the next time we visit.

After walking around for a bit back in January, I needed a place to relax and grab a bite to eat.   This place looked inviting so I stopped in.  Great beer selection and the food was delicious.  Staff was also very friendly.  I left after having about 4 more beers than I planned to.

Friendly managers and good vibes from the staff. It makes the experience funner and more comfortable. They have plenty of group seating downstairs and more intimate seating on the street level and upstairs. They have 3 bars, so great for parties as well. Will probably be back. Thanks for being awesome!

You are going to love The Malt House. Menu items are good and the staff is very friendly. Short Rib Sliders that I have ordered was absolutely magnificent, it had so much flavor and was absolutely delightful. Polite staff- they're so nice. Definitely recommend The Malt House.

The seasonal fish tacos were sem at best.  They had Mahi Mahi as the seasonal catch, but the fish tasted like the grill and the black beans were under cooked. I should have went with a burger or something more pub grub like.

Went looking for a casual place for lunch and walked into the Malt House. The place is a bit crowded and noisy, the service is above average. The choice of beers were excellent and I enjoyed the freshly made tacos. Friendly staff made us feel welcome.

Food was good! Mimosa wasn't my favorite, but they had some other fun options for brunch cocktails. Our waiter started out very attentive, and then the place got busier and he definitely dwindled with refilling our drinks. We did bottomless and I really don't feel like I got $25 worth of drinks. They did have pitchers ready to refill drinks which made it faster, but I think I only had about 3 drinks which during a bottomless, I would have hoped for a couple more. Maybe it's just me but I left satisfied since the chicken and waffle club was so good!

Came here for dinner and drinks with a friend.  The restaurant itself was well decorated.  It was very busy and very full of people when we arrived around happy hour.  We were seated at a small table in the front of the restaurant within about 30 minutes of arriving. The food and beer were both good, but nothing to brag about.  It was extremely loud and pretty difficult to have a conversation.

A beautiful bottomless brunch spot at FiDi. Came here with a large group  to celebrate a friend's birthday and we had an amazing time. The place is lovely, the food and ambiance is great. Although we were downstairs with other groups, we didn't feel like it was too loud to the point where we couldn't hear each other. The waiter came back multiple times to refill our drinks. You will definitely get your moneys worth of drinks if you come here for bottomless!

Nice place to go grab brunch. Got the malt house omelet which tasted amazing. Would definitely try again. Nice decor and atmosphere with a huge bar. Try to sit in the front of the shop or upstairs if open. Service was horrible, so much attitude and rudeness which I don't see in California much. Good food tho.

The plates are big enough and they are delicious! We ordered bottomless mimosas and it was my friends bday and they gave him a free dessert (it was the shit!!) i will definitely come back next time I visit NYC. Our server's name was Gillian and he was so friendly and nice.

Went here for brunch and had a fantastic meal. The burger was juicy and cooked perfectly (medium rare) for my tasting. Portions are big and filled my brunch apetite. Isn't very price for NYC and good atmosphere.

I went to this restaurant thinking nothing of it, but as soon as I came inside I was welcomed by one of the two servers that were​ working. She was super sweet and led me to a table right away. For there being only two servers that night and having a full house, she remained poised​​ and nice all night long. She took my order and the food came out quick! The tables were also big enough to fit my entree, my boyfriend's entree and still some room for our drinks. We were treated well despite the rush and the food was delicious! Mostly all of the food has alcohol in it though so not suitable for children, as the restaurant is half-bar half-restaurant. The best part about this place is that it stays open late (til 3 am​), so if you're craving some good tavern eats late at night with some live​ly music and friendly servers, this is the place to go!

We decided to stop here after reading the reviews on Yelp.  It was around 1:30pm after spending all morning at the 9/11 museum.  The place was crowded, but the 3 of us were seated right away at a small table near the front.  I had the chicken and waffle sandwich with fries with a Bronx Blonde on draft.  It was great!  My husband had the wings which he loved.  He had Sloop IPA.  My ultra picky teenage daughter loved her short rib breakfast burrito!  Giving this place five stars considering we all loved our meals.

I was visiting the national 911 memorial and wanted to get something good to eat with a drink and a good atmosphere. Well after yelping some places within walking distance I found this place. It has a nice feel to it and the food was great. They have a good choice of hand held food or something that requires a knife and fork. I wasn't that hungry so I just had some hot wing sliders and they did not disappoint. Topped it off with a Jameson whiskey with some ginger beer and I was all set. Give it a try, it won't disappoint.

Walked off the Brooklyn Bridge and refused to eat fast food. In my semi-starved state of mind made my way into the aforementioned Malt house. Sabrina met us and seated us and immediately for a great starter Bloody Mary. Wifey had the classic American breakfast and I went wild with the turkey BLT. In less than a minute food was served fresh and neat. The food, atmosphere and music were incredible. Having been touristed on day one to NYC I was very pleased with my brunch experience at the Malt House. Highly recommend.
My company had an event in their private room downstairs (had tv, food and bar).   Since I don't drink, I could only judge how much others drank.   They seemed to enjoyed themselves.

Delicious burger and fries. Friendly staff. Fun environment. Whether joining buds for a beer or catching a quick bite on the run, this is a solid choice in the FiD

Nothing fancy about fish tacos  or the burger bites ( it is like dumpling) I would recommend only Burger here.

Very good pub food.  We had great service. The wings and cheese curds were awesome and the chicken sandwich was very good.  The only issue i had was how uncomfortable and tiny the seating was.  We were a part of 4 cramped on top of each other w very little room for our plates and drinks.  And the tiny round seat wasn't at all comfortable.  Maybe try sitting at the bar if your going to stay longer than a half hour.

I went there yesterday with a friend and it was very crowded. The host was very friendly and was able to offer us a table all the way in the back. The Happy hour food and prices were amazing. The fish tacos were delicious as well as the cheese puffs. I had sangria and it was very good as well. The only cons is the very loud music. We have to scream in order to talk to our friends. Wow!  this place has gone downhill ... it used to be my go to in the financial district.  New management thought it was a good idea to increase prices by 25-30% for everything on the menu, and clearly cut costs all around ... now the quality is lower and prices are  outrageous.  I'm not the only one who feels this way, it is clearly less popular now ... it used to be hopping.  It will be my last time here.  Way to screw up a good thing
Food is tasteless! Service slow, ambient is nice but not enough to compensate for other shortcomings!

Our waitress Hazel, was amazing.  With quick service and spot on recommendations based on our interest.  She added much character and charm to the Malthouse, an Irish gastronomic pub.  Check out my pics and you will see you'll not want to miss this spot

Best meal we had while visiting in NYC. We stumbled upon this place as it was close to our hotel. We were greeted right away at the bar. I ordered man n cheese, truffle fries, and my husband order the ribs. Everything was delicious! It was a bit quiet inside but it was late on a Sunday night. I'm sure given the location the happy hour is hopping here.

Just leaving the malt house. I had an incredibly negative experience here.  The service was absolutely terrible.  One of the servers Paul decided that he could be really familiar with me (even though I've never met him in my life).  He decided to use a what I consider a racial slur in my country of descent and tell me that "I should stop talking because I sound like a real fucking idiot".  Needless to say I canceled my order and promptly left with my friends.  I'll never return to this place.
Terrible customer service. The chick and waffles are decent not impressed. The manager has no class or social skills (he is Irish with red hair). The waitresses are great though

The Malt House has an admirable craft beer selection. The bison sliders were quite good. But the best thing about Malt House was bartender Liz, who was not only very helpful with offering food recommendations, but was also very generous with her time in discussing beer, whiskey, and vodka recommendations.
Nice and clean place. Tasty food we tried: salmon sandwich, soup of the day, natural fries. Friendly staff.

Came here on cinco de mayo. I got the chicken and waffles, which was amazing and my boyfriend got the full malty. Both were really yummy! Atmosphere is very fun, very loud. Our bartender/waitress Hannah was amazing. So sweet and attentive. Overall it's a good place just to get a meal/ bottomless brunch. The drinks were flowing and Hannah honestly hooks it up. I would def come bck again.
No comment
Cool place, really loud at lunch time, koji salad yummy, but very few vegetarian options.

I had a Holiday party this past week and wanted to switch things up this year and decided to go with some items from The Malt House. I went with the Seared Lamb Lollipops, Cubano sliders and Caprese Bruschetta. Now i order from 3 other restaurants in the area but all my guest were asking is where I had ordered the above items from, they were great everyone gave them rave reviews the Lamb Lollis and Cubanos were a favorite of everyone I should have ordered more but now i know this going forward for future events. I dealt with Leland Estes and he was a doll and such a sweet guy. We will deff be checking the place out for some drinks soon.

Came here with coworkers for HH and we were pleasantly surprised. I liked how they offer small bites on the HH menu - the rosemary fries and cheese curds were delicious. We got a second order of fries because they were so good. I got a glass of red wine which was tasty as well. It was a bit loud but other than that I liked the ambience, which was somewhat dark and pub-ish, good for groups if you can snatch one of the tables.

The food was amazing, highly recommend the pasta and the buttermilk bites. But the service was not that great, we were asked to move for a big table, which was fine with us until we realized we were not able to see the tv and saw how squished we were next to the big party while the whole other side was empty. We asked to move to the top but the waiters said it was not open, which is okay but she saw we were trying to move and she didn't ask us if we'd like to move else where. It took them a while to check on us, the waiter finally did and he's a super friendly guy, it just was a little late.
No comment

Drinks were good/okay but food left a lot to be desired. Quality was borderline fast food or low value chain restaurant. Service was pleasant. Also, given that it was maybe half full, no reason to have the music so loud I had to yell when conversing with my wife.

Came here on a Wednesday around 8:30pm for drinks with about 13 other people. The bar were pretty crowded, too crowded for us all to stand and chat. The waitress was nice enough to accommodate our group at a large picnic style table next to the window. The bar was pretty loud and dark, but the ambiance was nice. The bar was decorated with lights and there was also a Christmas tree, it was very festive for the holiday season. The draught beer selection was big, but in order to see it you had to get up and go look at the chalk board behind the bar. Pretty inconvenient when you're sitting at a table far away from the bar with a large group. I guess this just means they change the taps and keep everything fresh since they don't have a printed menu.  I would definitely like to come back for happy hour to try it again.

We were sadly a half hour late for our sunday brunch reservation (thank you very much track maintenance on the Path train) and they were very gracious and still took us despite turning others away for not having a reservation.  We did the bottomless brunch and the food was amazing, the brunch cocktails kept coming, and our experience was lovely.  I had the chicken waffle club (strongly recommend) and my wife had the american breakfast.  Fantastic.  The decor is steampunk hipster and we thoroughly enjoyed the time there.  Will be returning!

Crowded, but to be expected. Got here at 5:20 on a work day and we were able to find a spot at the bar (thanks to some kind gentlemen!) within 10 minutes or so. Happy hour specials are worth it - drinks are very reasonable and varied for HH (my friends got beers and I did the MH Mule). Food was addicting - especially those fries oh my!!!

Raging, obnoxious brunch. This place may be a little TOO hip for its own good. Screechy, drunk frat girls are drawn by the pounding, throbbing party and pop music. Don't let the pub decor fool you. You're going to a nighclub, during the day, with food. And the mgmt progressively boosts the music until you can hear nothing but "whoop whoop", and "ohmygawd, I'm soooo drunk". If you plan to have an actual conversation with friends over a nice meal, you'll only get one of the two. Food was good but not a lot of choice, and most items were heavy, not much light fare to choose from though portions weren't too oversized. Bring your own disco ball. Wait staff was friendly enough but gave up after awhile and didn't see our waitress for 20 mins.
One of the best Mimosas I've ever had. Loved the food. Highly recommend the brunch burrito. Absolutely fabulous. We drank more than 2 hours worth of our bottomless drinks.
My kind of place. Good beer list, fast service, and quick food delivery. And it's only Tuesday. Great job.

Came to Malt House with a friend out of town. The street it is on is sort of creepy at night. We made reservations but it didn't seem like they were needed. Our waitress was a little slow coming over to initially greet us and also to take our order. Food came out via runner very quickly. We both ordered the Malt House Turkey Club which felt a little overpriced for a sandwich but overall pretty tasty. It had a little bit of a spiciness to it. Great atmosphere but pretty loud. I felt like I was screaming the whole time. Overall a great place to meet up with friends for dinner in FiDi.

Good beer (they carry the coconut porter I love so much) and mixed drinks, but the food is your standard pub fare. Rosemary fries and buffalo sliders were good, but the fried chicken bites with aioli dip tasted like baking soda. Maybe their actual entrees are better, but we were only interested in drinks and a few shared plates.

Eaten a lunch and a dinner at The Malt House over the past week, and was impressed both times. Energetic FiDi crowd day and night, great food, good drink selection, and very clean bathrooms! The carnitas tacos are fantastic. Emma was a very friendly and attentive server!

Food is so good! Drinks are so good! Margaritas, Mules, you name it. Please check out the happy hour- chicken is delicious. My only complaint is how busy and LOUD this place gets. It makes it very hard to interact with more than one person.

Cocktail atmosphere is really pleasant even though it fills up by 6pm on weekdays.  I have been out with office groups for happy hour many times.  The dinner and food is very average but the atmosphere makes it fun and not every dinner has to be a Michelin experience.  BUT, the place has gotten full of itself and prices are way up.   4 mid tier bourbons and 2 beers was $104 on my last trip, including a surprise $30 shot over rocks.   We spoke to the manager and he said he had to charge us because we drank it even though the price wasn't known before we ordered.   Bad business.
No comment

Had my doubts but the place since placed with bars or going for that fancy plating may not always have the best food or portions but it had a nice ambiance, friendly staff, and tasty food that was worth the higher prices. The baby back ribs had a tasty sauce and a lot of meat while the salad I had had very fresh ingredients and the chicken was nicely grilled. Didn't have the Mac and cheese but saw someone else order it and didn't expect it to be such a healthy portion. There were also a nice variety of beer on tap

Food was amazing, but service was lack luster. We had like 5 servers... it would change every time someone came to the table and when someone did come to the table they wouldn't stand still long enough to hear what we wanted... then it would take 10-15 mins to get the drink we asked for etc.... better service and this place would be amazing.
Best brunch I've ever had!  Everything was so tasty. I ordered the two scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage. Oh, and I added a side of avocado!!!  Will definitely be back.
No comment
No comment
The bottomless brunch deal is great. Mason jars are used for the mimosas and they keep flowing! Brunch food is great too! Definitely worth a try!
Great food. Large selection of alcohol, over 40 beers on tap. Enormous, architecturely beautiful space. Ambiance is great. Staff is super attentive and friendly. Highly recommend this place.

Great Food! I'm from san diego, CA and love trying out places. I highly recommend the Orecchiette pasta with chicken, garlic cream sauce, mushrooms, and spinach. Also if you like scotch their "Executive Director" mixed drink was fantastic!

The brunch was good, in terms of the entrees. The bottomless cocktails though were rough. They sound great on the menu, but they are making them behind the bar in pitchers that become warm and watered down. It reminded me of the quality you'd receive at the bars in collage (think big ten football game day college bars).I hope that's not how they're serving their non-bottomless brunch cocktails. All in all, we had a nice time but this won't be a place I'll be making it a point to return.
No comment
No comment

This was a Saturday lunch in the neighborhood and lo and behold the place was packed and jumpin'. No luck, reservations only we were told by the pleasant maitre'd with the Irish accent. I said, well my wife is disabled but could there be a spot at the bar? He went out of his way to accommodate us there and the journey began. One of us had  braised short ribs and poached eggs on a bed of  polenta, the other fried chicken breast and waffle club. Food was B+ only because the short rib was a little dry...and this from my companion who is a former syndicated restaurant critic for Scripps Newspapers. The bartender was full of personality and made everything just right. Note: this is a serious bourbon joint. Maybe 200 choices including Pappy Van Winkle 15 yr @$250 a  shot. We are coming back.
No comment
No comment

Normally I give Malt House a 5 star review. Ive been to both locations many times and have recommended Malt House to lots of friends. I even threw a 60 person private party at the Fidi location. Unfortunately on this Friday I had an upsetting experience. I was sitting at the downstairs bar when one of the managers, Brendan, reprimanded an employee right in front of me and all of the other patrons and staff. Completely unprofessional. It was not a quick reprimand either but a full out reprimand including discussions of warnings, suspensions etc. Very inapprorpriate to do this in front of patrons. I tried to find the manager on my way out to let him know my feelings but couldnt find him so had to resort to yelp.
Great food and friendly service. My mini burger was so juicy and the sauce on it was amazing

After a week in the city, we were so pleased with the low-key vibe of this establishment. The beer selection was good, but better was the food. My friend and I agreed the fish tacos were easily the best we've ever had. The service was also great; they were attentive and kind and helpful. What a great way to end our trip!
No comment

We enjoyed the cheese curds with these 2 spicey dipping sauces. We ordered the bison sliders and the garlic chicken orrechio pasta, and ribeye sandwich! Check this place out for flavorful food! Nice decor! Friendly service!

This place is awesome for happy hours and a great cocktail spot . Food is off the charts , I had the cheese curds and chicken tacos . Everything is fresh . The ambiance in the place is great . Like a 70s cocktail bar . Very mad men esque . You gotta try this place !

Walked in an hour before closing and the guys working at the bar said they were closed. CHANGE HOURS ON YELP IF EMPLOYEES ARE GOING TO LIE ABOUT BEING OPENED. Shitty employees if you ask me. Lost the business money.
OMG!!!  Great food and drinks. I stayed across the street and they have delivery with my hotel. The food is amazing. I went for lunch the next day and staff was great!

I've been walking by Malt House twice a day on my way to and from work, and have wanted to try it really badly because it looked really cute.  Finally tried it and was not disappointed.  My waitress was so attentive and sweet even though we were the only guests sitting on the second floor.  My only complaint was the size of my fish - a pretty scrawny piece of striped bass.  I will definitely come back for drinks.
No comment
Fun FiDi neighborhood restaurant serving good food with a lively atmosphere on Mermaid Street!
No comment

I was rather disappointed with this establishment. As someone who visits the city on a regular basis I often find myself exploring new restaurants and bars to keep up the variation and excitement. Most recently me and a group of friends found ourselves at The Malt House for brunch and I have to say our experience could not have been more disappointing. First off the bottomless mimosas were horrendous. The mimosas arrived at our table in dirty plastic jugs and were heavily watered down. In addition, I ordered the chicken and waffles as part of the bottomless brunch which arrived at the table in a sloppy mess. This only led to further disappointment with the chicken being cold and the waffle being soggy. Everything was way overpriced considering the terrible quality and lack of service. If you enjoy watered down drinks, slow service, and cold food then I highly recommend The Malt House.
Great spot for drinks and food. A hidden gem of a neighborhood place down in the financial district!

Prices were as expected for the area but worth it for a beer and bar food. I had the burger with salad and Mermaid pilsner while my partner had the chicken sandwich. We shared the chicken bites as appetizer and both agreed to skip it next time. The rest of food was delicious. Fun decor, spacious, and great service.

Make sure you get the right neighborhood for this restaurant-I totally ended up in the wrong location and had to run to catch a train to FiDi. The fried food was great along with the sauces, and the nachos were alright (hard to live up to anything I have in California). Easy place to grab a good lunch if you work nearby.
This is just an amazingly chic but unpretentious place in the heart of the Financial District. Amazing drink and crafted cocktail selection. Hope to be back soon!

We came here for happy hour a few days ago. My friend got a drink first, and then I went to the bar to order for myself. I got two times less of volume then my friend - I think it is because they liked my friend more for some reason. Btw, bar was empty yet waitress never attended me so I had to chase her for another drink after sitting with empty glass for half an hour. No more comments.
No comment

Came here for brunch with a bunch of co-workers this weekend. Food was good, I got the Ham Benedict with a tasty avocado sauce and everyone else enjoyed their choices as well. 2 hour bottomless cocktails for $20 is a good deal, and service was great about refilling empty glasses. Our waitress seemed a little distant and not super friendly, but the atmosphere and food makes it a solid choice for FiDi.

Really good happy hour until 6. The HH includes cheap, but quality, food and drinks. I really liked the chicken bites and fries. Nice open space with multiple levels. The lower level is great to reserve for work gatherings and parties as it's not too pricey and each section has its own dedicated full bar. Kind of a suits and bro scene during HH, but not everything can be perfect.

Wait. Malt House is legitimately awesome. The food tastes good and you could tell chefs with passion were whipping up the meals. Meredith is a legend. Shes the best server ever. Malt House FiDi is where you need to be. It's great for big parties but also good for a more intimate group. I am currently chewing the breakfast burrito and listen,.. I feel terrific. The bottomless drinks deal is unreal. Mimosas and Bellinis - unstoppable. I'm coming back here often. Read my review. Understand that it's sincere. Malt House is where you need to be.

We ended up coming here twice while we stayed a week in the area. The bartenders were cool and we found the beer selection very good. Our favorite thing on the menu was the turkey sandwich which we'll be dreaming about until we come back.
Great place for lunch.   Food was delicious.  Waitress very sweet and accommodating.   Will go back!
The best in all New York, the service and the attention is incredible, the food is delicious and the atmosphere is very nice

Come to this place after work, the beer is excellent, the whiskies numerous, and the ambience is dark and chic. The menu looks good, a lot of flavorful dishes are listed, but there was something off about my food, terribly reheated. This was a perfect spot for a late night date, and I would consider going back on the weekend for their bottomless brunch. I recognized some of the menu items, like the cabbage salad, from another local spot, and I didn't like it there so I didn't order it here even though I really wanted a salad. The salad options were very weird, a sweet summer strawberry salad (in winter) or this crunchy cabbage salad. I could have gone for a simple garden salad or some sort of vegetable dish. Avoid this place at all costs if you are vegan or allergic to dairy because there is cheese on every single item, even items without cheese listed, and the (V)s on the menu refer to cheesy vegetarian items, definitely not vegan. If you want flavorful bar food, chill ambience, and good drinks, this is a good spot. If you like fresh food and you're looking for a good meal maybe go somewhere else, there are a lot of options in this neighborhood, even late night.

Malt House is located in the Financial District and very close to Fulton Station. There are two floors; the bottom floor is cozy and great for events or after work happy hours. Although, don't get too carried away as they have a tight cap on Fun downstairs! Upstairs the bar is okay, little louder and more open, and typical of a FiDi happy hour locale. Service upstairs is typically quite good as bartenders here are attentive and respectful. Prices are reasonable with good happy hour specials, but minor menu adjustments could make a difference (like naming fried cheese curds basically any other name). Overall would recommend for a casual after work drink.

Went here for lunch, as it is just down the block from my job.It was very noisy, and crowded but what else can you expect given the location? The food was great! I had sweet potato fries with lobster mac and cheese. They both tasted great! They served the food pretty quickly given lunch is timed.  I've had all of their cocktails they're all great as well but they're so small they're teasers!!
Unfriendly place. The bartender was more preoccupied with trying to hook up than help the paying customers. Food was disappointing.
Don't arrive at 3:30 expecting real food its mostly breakfast choices, very limited lousy selection.

Came here on a whim after getting in from LGA and it did NOT disappoint! The Salmon Po Boy is one of the best sandwiches I've ever had and the rosemary fries are to die for! Great vibe and even better music!!

Absolutely amazing. Some of the best service ever. We had a super large party last minute and they were BEYOND accommodating! Gio was the most amazing server and even went out of his way to split our checks individually. The food was so yummy and the bottomless drinks were so tasty. We will definitely be coming here again.
No comment
I have been to both locations. They both have terrible oysters so do noooooot get them. However, they do have good happy hour deals for other things. Just avoid the oysters!!

Having visited The Malt House because the other place we wanted to try was closed, we weren't expecting that much. However, we were very pleasantly surprised! The place is nice, spacious and classy; none of that tables-so-close-you-can-hear-your-neighbour's-every-inhalation situation. The food were the stars though! I had the wagyu burger and my boyfriend had the ribeye steak and both were so good! I am one of those annoying people who eat burgers with a fork and knife but I was more than happy to get my fingers dirty for this one. We also shared a plate of the buttermilk bites which were divine. Another note-worthy item is the fries. I don't love fries but man, I could not stop eating the ones here! They were crunchy, flavourful and just the right size. Boyfriend also enjoyed the nice selection of beers. We'll most definitely be back!

Nice place for appetizers and drinks. The nachos were tasty but a little too small for the price. Craft beer selection was ok. Also had the beignets but they were more like cinnamon and sugar donut holes, still tasty with the ice cream and chocolate syrup they came with but, I wouldn't call them beignets. Overall, hood experience.
No comment
Meet some friends during their honeymoon from Italy. Had great time food good drinks little skimpy but no complain. Nice server and host. Will be back.
No comment

A true gem in this area which is the hardest place to find decent food. The ambiance is laid back with great soft lighting and a large space. The buttermilk bites are a must, still thinking about the cilantro dip that comes along with it. Also a must try is their loaded nachos, we tried it with chicken and it was yummy. I wasn't too crazy about the burger but it might have been due to the bread which was not warmed but rather cold. The portions are huge and they have large screen tvs perfect place to watch sporting games.

Came here with a large party for bottomless brunch. We were seated downstairs at a long table, but it is my understanding that they sometimes give larger parties a private room upstairs. I got the short rib breakfast burrito which was really great and filling, I definitely recommend it! I substituted fries for the breakfast potatoes and they were crispy and delicious.  My friends had the chicken and waffles dish and could not stop raving about it! I think if I go again I have to try it. We stuck to the blood orange screwdrivers, which were a nice change from a regular vodka + orange juice. Our waitress was really awesome and continued giving us pitchers even after the 2 hours had elapsed. My friend and I were celebrating our birthdays, so the restaurant gave us both a super decadent toffee cake dessert with ice cream and caramel sauce. Overall, a really great spot for brunch where you can totally get the most bang for your buck!
No comment

Racist establishment beware!!! They refused to give us menus (we had to borrow from the table next to us) then wouldn't honor the "happy hour" rate for our table (though our bill was over $110). The dumb little girls who work there are ignorant and rude. When I was asking why our happy hour specials weren't being honored- I kept getting called "love" and "sis"... 1- I don't know you... 2- I'm a grown ass woman so stop.

Great food and atmosphere. There was a very large menu of craft beer on tap. Bison sliders, nachos and mac and three cheese were amazing. All the waitress' are beautiful too so that's just an extra perk.

Found this place just blocks from our hotel on a night out, and couldn't be happier! Late night dining that doesn't feel like late night. It is easy to find and there is prompt service at the door. We were offered seating in 2 locations which was appreciated. Our server was sweet and very helpful with the craft beer menu and offered us drinks we wound up really enjoying. They do offer still or sparkling water as well. The lighting was muted and the ambiance was intimate. Everything on the menu sounded delicious and I wound up ordering the southern fried chicken, it was cooked perfectly and the sides were incredible. It comes with a chipotle mash and Mexican shaved corn, I could eat those every day. The chicken was cooked 3/4 perfectly, one piece was a little burnt and over cooked but it was far from inedible. My girlfriend ordered the tacos and she loved them, they were spicy and had nice big slices of fresh avocado. Once we were finished there was no pressure to order dessert or to leave immediately, it was a very relaxed experience. If you find yourself in the NYC financial district do yourself a favor and stop in for a good meal and drinks.

This place is great if you're looking for good drinks and lively ambiance.. however, if you're looking to dine in.. make sure you're not that hungry because the service is pretty slow.. other than that. Good food and good drinks.
Cool place, always busy. Stop by for happy hour bites- they're pretty good. Prices are in line with FiDi... not a huge selection on the happy hour menu though.
Fantastic steak salad! Loved the soup and the fries are highly recommended. I'm giving it 4 stars because I was a big fan of the service when I went there. A bit of a "pissy" mood server
The best happy hour menu in FiDi. My coworker and I come here at least once a week, and absolutely love it. Great drinks and food!

Really like this place! The food is delicious even though the service is kind of slow, it's worth the wait.  I had the nachos and french fries. Hit the spot. Regardless if you're with a group, or just a friend, forget about that diet and order some fries. You won't regret it. Maybe even throw in the spinach dip (didn't have the chance to try that but it sounded delicious)!
No comment

Excellent service with a space that seems a bit larger than usual. The pasta across the board is delicious. Excellent appetizers, each dish is cooked with great flavor and this location was a pleasant surprise.

I came for brunch with a friend. For $15 you get a pretty good selection of drink included with the AYCD special. The waitress was good about refilling our glasses and eventually brought over a pitcher of mimosas. I was also impressed with the food. I went with the chicken fried steak eggs benedict and found it delicious. The steak was pounded and fried well and the seasoning was spot on. Portions were large and I wan't able to finish. I tried a friends french toast and it was also delicious, if you're a french toast fan I highly recommend it. I'll definitely return, the price was very reasonable for the options and quality.

Stopped in this place on a Sat afternoon. Very nice open space. Friendly staff. Only negative is that brunch menu was still going on at 3 pm and that was only menu you could order from. Menu change would not occur til 4pm, I wasn't going to sit there for an hour, not eating. So had to order from brunch menu. Great selection of craft beers. Would like to try their regular menu.

This place is great for bottomless brunches. The food was good and so were the drinks. The only suggestion that I have is to add the waffles to the bottomless brunch entre menu. Other than that is great.
Everything we ordered was delicious. And the Barry White Saved My Life is the best drink ever. Everything was 5 star and our waitress Vickie was a 10!
We stopped by after the 9/11 museum with a group of 5. The restaurant has an open feel and a menu that can satisfy anyone from tacos to salads, everything was delicious. Good beers and cider on tap!

Upsetting I had 6 henny sours and a long island ice tea and it was as if I had 2 beers these people rob you! The henny sour was just lemonade.. left w. An upset stomach and the the LIT taste like medicine... bull

Stopped by the Malt House after work one day with a few girlfriends. It was packed and a nice place for happy hour with all professionals. Since the upstairs was too busy, we went into the basement where it was a nice laid back vibe. They had some drink specials which was an added bonus. I would return.

The malt house is fancy and sophisticated, yet relaxing and fun. Like its older sister on Thomson & Bleecker The Malt House on FiDi is always a great spot to stop by a drink after work or to meet some friend. And please, if you can check out the whiskey floor!!! Can't remember how I got home xD

What a great find!! This pub had great food. We had a Wygu burger, the Mac n cheese and the yummy French fries. We sampled a few of the beers and then Trevor (not our server but maybe manager) helped my Husband find the beer on Untapped. From there he let us taste 4 other local NY beers. Fantastic experience all around! Would totally recommend stopping by for a snack, drink or lunch! (PS we also had our kids with us and they were happy - ages almost 9 and almost 6)
Like this place a lot - good service and food, especially the burger. The only downside is it gets pretty crowded and noisy, so it's best to go during off-hours.
Bottomless mimosas ($18 for 2 hours) and great food... the perfect combination. Can't wait to stop by the next time I'm in NY!

Such a cute spot!  I came here for a holiday lunch with some colleagues and we had a great time.  Pretty big space with a rustic-chic atmosphere, there are at least 2 floors and we had the downstairs practically to ourselves.  We ordered a ton of apps, the onion rings and sliders stick out to me the most as being oh so yummy, but everything was pretty good.  I also had the chicken tacos as my entree, which was good, but I think next time I will try the fish tacos as some other people had them and they looked really good.  This place is awesome for happy hour, it always looks packed during that time and I absolutely want to come back here during the summer!
Excellent brunch!! B.E.C. was amazing, as was the avocado toast. Great atmosphere. Knowledgeable bartender. Awesome beer selection!!
Their drink selection sucks for happy hour but their appetizers are a great deal. I really love their fries and MH sauce and it's probably the main reason I go there now lol.
Cold craft beer. Great food. Fast service. Large televisions with every sports package. Two floors of seating.

Happened upon this place after some shopping at Century 21, which really builds up the appetite! Small menu but very interesting! My daughter had the Fried Chicken Waffle Club (pan fried chicken breast, avocado, bacon, romaine and chorizo gravy) and I had the Grilled Cheese (aged cheddar, andouille sausage, peppers, onions and chipotle aioli). Both were out of this world delish and came with amazing hand cut fries. I rarely eat more than 5 fries with anything I order but I polished off all of them...highly recommend this place and will return on our next visit!

What a great place. I had the  wagyu burger and it was so flavorful and rich. WHEN I come here again, I'll have them hold the bacon (don't judge!) as the flavor of the wagyu can more than carry its own. The rest of the family enjoyed theirs as well. Great and cool vibe here.
Gave the place a chance for breakfast and was pleasantly surprised. Everything tasted delicious!!
Fantastic brunch and fantastic late night dinner. Had the Mac and cheese both for brunch and dinner. It was even better the second time. Avocado today is UNREAL. Best place I've eaten in a while.
very fun place!  drinks are reasonably price and while we only had a few appetizers, the food was pretty good! Service was friendly, we came around 9pm on a Thursday and were sat immediately
No comment

Best brunch place!! I have gone to this restaurant many times and could easily keep returning because of how good it is. Bottomless brunch is a fair price and they make it worth the money. Dinner is also amazing, many tasty options. Very spacious inside, great for big or small groups!

Great local lunch spot with an extensive bar with a friendly atmosphere & staff. Brunch and lunch is excellent, and the venue doesn't feel cramped at all. If you are planning on going, I would recommend that you make a reservation, as this location is often quite busy.
Amazing relaxed atmosphere with delicious whiskey well made drinks. Beer selections was quite nice and bartenders very attentive.
No comment
Ok I can legit die now. Get the turkey BLT and thank me later. Also, see Sean, spelled the right way, at the bar because he's freakin awesome, makes great drinks and tells great stories!!!

Have been here before for happy hour and dinner and  thought it was a decent place. Wouldn't come back for brunch ever. The service was beyond slow - almost embarrassingly. We got bottomless brunch. I can kick back many a mimosa - I got 3 because the service was so slow. They got my cousins last drink wrong after she waited almost 45 minutes for it and we couldn't even tell them because we never saw the waitress again until after we paid the bill. Someone else had to bring us the bill even though she was still working. The waitress had a horrible attitude from the start and just seemed like she didn't want to be there. We asked for another drink at the end despite being slightly past our two hours ( didn't drink until 1 and it was 3:30)  to which she responded you're already 2 hours past your time. First how about check your math? Second don't back talk the customer EVER. We were polite the way we asked. We said well the service was a bit slow to which she back talked AGAIN and said well your drinks were full the whole time. Au contraire - my drink was empty almost the whole time maybe one person in our party had a full drink.  She could have just given us another round of the watered down mimosas but instead wanted to pick a fight which I think says a lot. She was despicable. The table was also TINY and we sat on stools which isn't my favorite. Overall won't be coming back from brunch. Might try happy hour again but not even sure of that.

After a really late start, we found this place around the corner from our hotel this past Saturday evening.  We got there about 10:30 pm and I was surprised to see the bar wasn't even that busy especially since there was a Yankees playoff game on!  We sat at the bar and were warmly greeted by the bartender.  This is a really spacious place and the decor is pretty nice.  We asked the bartender for some food suggestions and she was very helpful.  We decided to share the buttermilk chicken bites and the pork sliders.  The buttermilk chicken bites came with two kinds of dipping sauces and were in a really tasty batter and not greasy at all.  The pork sliders were awesome.  Very tasty and served with a cole slaw on top of them which gave them a nice kick.  This is definitely a great neighborhood place to come to as well as a good place to watch a sports event.  Would definitely come back.  And the Yankees won!
No comment

Sunday brunch was a breakfast menu and Not a buffet.  Omelette & eggs Benedict were big w a nice greens salad.  Burgers and beer are the fare of choice.  Walking distance to 911memorial.  Server was ok
Came in for some good bar food and drinks and got exactly that. Steak sandwich was great... as were the fries, drinks, and other apps ordered.
It was a specialty beer pub, the lighting was gorgeous and very spacious. The bartenders were very helpful selecting our beers, and you can choose to taste them before you order one.

Friendly people and good food. It has a bar feel, but with a elevated menu. I had the garlic chicken and it was spectacular. The service was excellent and the staff cares about this place. For the price, you won't find a better option.

We tried Malt House for a Saturday brunch before going to see the Statue of Liberty. The food was OK, not great. I had the eggs Benedict and my husband had the special for the day which was some Mac-n-cheese waffle thing. The most disappointing part was my mimosa - it had almost no carbonation at all as it had been pre-prepared (they have a $25 bottomless option and it appeared drinks were pre-mixed in pitchers). The service and the ambience were worth 3 stars, but better food and drink can be found elsewhere in NYC.

This is one of my favorite places for lunch/dinner in the FiDi area.  The service is always welcoming and friendly.  It can get pretty crowded around happy hour but happy hour ends at 6:00PM and it usually clears out a bit a little after that.  During happy hour they offer select drafts for $5.00 and liquor & certain wine for $6.00.  They also have a few apps they offer for $5.00 during HH as well.  Of these apps, my friends & I usually share the buttermilk chicken bites & cheese curds which are really good.  For lunch/dinner, my favorites are the buttermilk fried chicken sandwich and malt house burger.
Had a great experience at the Malt House. Great selection of American beers. I thought the malt house Amber was one of the nicest I tasted on holidays in the U.S. great food and service too.

The Malt House was okay.  Stopped by for HH and nothing I ordered wow-ed me or made me feel like I had to come back (e.g., oysters were underwhelming - couldn't get through them, truffle fries weren't very truffley, and I'll say the fried pickles were better than average); though I will say the service was very friendly and prompt, and the atmosphere is lovely (doesn't look like a restaurant that'd be in this area of town)!

We were in FIDi looking for a place to dine that wasn't too fancy or too casual. The Malt House was the best of both worlds. The decor and atmosphere was comfortable yet true to the fall theme. They served drinks in mason glasses! We ordered steak salad and steak with fries. The waitress was also super nice and checked on us twice to make sure we were happy with our food and our drinks. Too. As we missed out on happy hour!
Ask for Christina! Great service, great music, awesome libations selection! Great social aspect at the bar. Visiting patrons very friendly. Worth a stop.

This is a nice bar, very spacious, nice decorations clean, etc. However, I was here this evening and did not have a good experience. I had been out with a few girlfriends previously in the day, which I understand may be annoying, but we did not bother anyone and sat at the bar to order a drink. The bartender thought it would be hilarious to make fun of us, not just once but many times throughout the night. I can take a joke, but it was rude and mean, especially when we were paying customers. There were also two men sitting a few feet away, and he did not seem to find the need to bother them in the way he was bothering us. He went out of his way to ask if we had work tomorrow, which was judgmental and uncalled for. I encounter rude and ignorant men constantly, and the last place I want to encounter it is at a late nights bar on a Sunday night, which is why I'm rating this 1. Don't be fooled by his Irish accent ladies

This is a great place for large groups! The Malt House FiDi came through for my wife and I when we were looking for a hang out spot for our family and friends who traveled in for our wedding weekend. The management and staff were incredibly helpful and reserving some tables for us, and as our group grew larger throughout the evening the good service did not subside. This was the perfect place for all of our guests to gather and catch up to kick off a great weekend. We had such a good time the first night, that we came back the day after the wedding for some late afternoon cocktails. The staff remembered us and greeted us with a champagne toast for the table. Everyone loved the food, beer, and cocktails, and this place is definitely Gluten-Free friendly. We will definitely be back!

Solid spot. Good drinks, gooooood food. The buttermilk bites are really good, the truffle fries are different (they are friggen huge and come in 9s) Not overly crowded or douchy. Service was spot on. Zero complaints.
Great spot. Only been to lunch and happy hour, not sure what the dinner scene is like but a great experience every time.
Limited but yummy brunch menus! The location was great, and ambiance was beautiful! Slightly pricey for a group of young 20 somethings.
Excellent draft selection nice ambience awesome service . Highly recommend for the non traditional tourist.

Very nice place. Can get a little loud but nothing too crazy. They have decent amount of space, and pretty good bar food (fries, nachos) and probably good courses. Bar area is long, but always full. They have great selection of beer, but can be a bit pricey. Definitely one of the better beer bars in Fidi, might be my favorite!
Overpriced and fish was fishy. Not worth it. The waiter didn't even notice I didn't eat my meal. Maybe they should pay attention.
No comment

We went The Malt House because it was across from our hotel. I had fish tacos, they were delicious. I didn't give 5 stars because the music was so loud that you cannot even have a conversation without shouting. But overall it was a good experience. If I stay downtown area next time, I probably order to go instead of dine in.
No comment
This place is amazing. In NYC for the weekend we Got a bunch of apps. Great American food
Best burger I've had in a long time... hands down. Truffle fries ($2 extra charge) is a must, they're $9 separately! --- in the back are the beer battered onion rings!
High(er) end brewhouse in FiDi. Great beer selection, nice atmosphere, and friendly service. Recommend the second floor for more ambiance.

Solid.  Nice open space but terrible acoustics around the bar make it loud even when not crowded.  Good Guac and those fried cheese curds are better than your average Mozz Stix.  Friendly servers and some big TVs get the job done.   FYI a splash of Bourbon is $15 so be ready.
Nope, Nope, definitely NOT! I ordered the Parmesan fries and they brought me old fries they've reheated. The fries are hard and bland. They didn't even bother to add salt to fries. #EpicFail #NiceTry

The food is okay, the space is cool, the beers are plenty, but the service is pretty terrible. They have messed up our order (brought us the wrong food) multiple times and messed up our check (charged us for things we didn't order) multiple times, because it seems like they just aren't paying attention, but at least they're pretty... I think they're authentically Irish...
LOVED this place.  Stopped in before a dinner reservation elsewhere.  Great service. had a nice snack.  Service was great and the beer and whiskey available was top notch.

What a pleasant surprise to find to end our visit in the city.  Was expecting typical wings and beer pub but was surprised by the very cool menu of food.  We were there for brunch on Sunday and what a great menu. We shared the Mac & Cheese and Wings to start and nothing was left.  The brunch burger is out of this world and my husband could not stop raving about the fried chicken waffle club. The slow braised breakfast burrito was a favorite of my sons.  Will def be back to try the other menus.

Nice and cozy atmosphere. We very much enjoyed our meals (especially the steak sandwich). Fair prices and very nice staff. Beer selection up to expectations. Not bad for a Sunday evening with family and/or friends.
This place is always good, but gets very crowded on weekends. Their beer is great, lots of seasonal Beers. Their food choices are also good.
This place has girls with they ass n titties hanging out for some reason, and also a hamburger is$20
No comment
Good place. Very friendly people. Liked the IPA. Unassuming frontage, but very nicely done inside. Good work.

Extensive range of quality drinks. Sliders- Amazing! Truffle fries- okay. Wings- Same as anywhere else. Nachos- Meh. Upscale setting with attentive staff. I would return for the drinks, setting and service but not necessarily the food

Visit to NYC and found the Malt House by walking by and stopped in.  Was super busy, but manager, Kevin (who is awesome!) said it would be about 15 minute for a table and walked us downstairs to the bar to wait.  Then personally came to get us to bring us to our table (did I mention Kevin is awesome?!)  He sat us up in the balcony area and took order to speed up our getting our food.  We had Mac &Cheese, Eggs Benedict with avacado sauce, waffles and red potato wedges all were awesome!! I was very impressed how the staff continued to check in and make sure were all set.  As I mentioned it was very busy so I didn't expect as much attention. Try it you won't be sorry- It is a short walk (less than 10 minutes) from the 911 Memorial and Museum.  So worth it! Go say hi to Kevin (who is really awesome and NO he didn't ask me to say that )  and the staff!

Came here for a slightly boozy lunch and found a new favorite neighborhood spot. The beer list is extensive and the food is really delicious - I tried the burger (which I have been craving ever since, SO good), buttermilk chicken bites, and Mac and cheese. The space is airy with wall-doors opening to the outside and so un-Manhattan, I love it. My two comments are 1) the food took a tad long to come out, but no crazy delays or anything and 2) I don't care for the closed off dining space, but that's a personal opinion on aesthetics. Can't wait to come back!

Not a bad bar. Didn't have any food but the bartenders seemed less than enthused to be there which immediately put you, the consumer in a bad spot becasue it feels like you're bothering them to get you your drink.  The restaurant and bar alone are beautiful in the way that every bar in Manhattan is these days with exposed beams and brick face.  Also surprise a bunch of wood.  All in all to be honest I would go back if i was in the neighborhood becasue it felt like the almost kinda tried to put on a respectable craft beer board.  Which for the record it wasn't.  One word summary cookiecutter but that may be 2.  So one or two word summary cookiecutter or cookie cutter.
Great food! Great customer service! Will come again! Just sad that they changed their menu options but over all great experience. Shout out to bartender Liz!
A great selection of beer and the staff really could answer questions about the beer.

Stopped here recently on a rainy Sunday afternoon with a couple folks. Probably a fun place most of the time but I found it terribly loud. We sat at a table (not the bar);  the food was ok. However, the service was slow and very inattentive, even though they weren't overly busy.....seems like they didn't care. And they weren't very friendly either.

My friends and I came by for Brunch and some bottomless orange screw drivers. The food was great I had a slow braised burrito eggs and my friends had chicken steak and waffles which was off the chain. The burrito eggs I had was good but I didn't get enough of the slow braised ribs in the eggs since they were cut into fine pieces but still enjoyed it. The waitresses were top notch. Emma was our waitress and she was very nice and accomadating. I do have to note there was a waitress who was so patient and was a trooper taking care of a very picky patron right next to our table. The patron kept complaining about the food and Shannon who was the waitress taking care of her didn't lose her cool at all. I was impressed with her professionalism and patience with this difficult patron. My friends and I will be coming back again since the food was great  and the wait staff was top notch.

The Malt House is a nice, upscale bar in FiDi with a fairly extensive list of beers on tap. So far, I've tried the buttermilk chicken sandwich, and the open faced steak sandwich. The chicken sandwich was the better of the two, although the steak sandwich was also good.

Do me a favor......take the time to find this place. Seriously. Great atmosphere. Great libations. And if it's not on the menu, ask for the burger. No really....this is literally one of the best burgers you'll have in FiDi. And yeah....there's an egg on top. Duh. As it should be. Just go.....trust Rob. Have I led you wrong yet??
The waitresses are nice, the food was great. I got he bottleless brunch and they are keeping track of my drinks. They made sure that our drinks were full. Love the settings! Will be back!
Well priced happy hour and their fried pickles are the bomb diggity!

Don't be shy and balk at the large crowd huddled by the bar. The crowd is sometimes what defines a place for me but when you enter, you are immediately greeted by a host and pleasantly surprised at the amount of seats available towards the back. They've got a great selection of draught beer and a wide selection of drinks with a nice sampling of house cocktails. We came with a group of six for happy hour on a Wednesday and ordered the chicken wings, truffle fries, and fried pickles. Great bar food and a variety of dipping sauce. Good savory food to pair with your awesome drinks!
No comment
Great beer list albeit pricey.  Burger was over cooked but tasty.   Wings could have used more heat.  Service was super fast - almost too fast.  Atmosphere solid.

We were wandering around NYC hungry and sick of hot dogs.  I looked on Yelp and found The Malt House.  We had a party of 8 on a Sunday morning during brunch hours and only 1 hour to eat... The wait staff totally made it happen.  The food was the best we had in NYC that week.  Great food, excellent service and wait staff!

The place has a cool layout and an extensive drink menu, I liked their glasses w a Doggy on it. Their troufle fries are yummy! I had the lobster bisque which was good and their burger was ok. It has a lounge area in the basement and a party room on the second floor, I would have to come back on another night to see if it gets more happening, though I was there on a Friday night.

Below average customer service. Bartender is not that interested in most customers at the bar. She is more interested in the co workers. Rosemary fries pretty good but wings burned with lots of hot sauce. Overpriced for what you get. Could be great place but disappointing.
Great beer selection, solid pub fare, and terrific waitstaff. The Malt House is a great destination if you're stuck in FiDi. They get my vote for the friendliest bartenders below 14th Street.

Went with some friends last night. Food was meh and the bartender at the front last night (sunday) was not very friendly to us or other customers at the bar; was actually pretty rude to everyone. Not a fun place. Probably won't go back.

I would give this place 7 stars if  I could. We recently had a corporate event here and everything was absolute perfection. They booked us in the private "Board Room" upstairs, and the ambience and style couldn't have been better for what we were going for- it was a perfect mix of sophistication without being stiffly daunting, elegantly casual and fun. The place was buzzing as early as 4 PM on a Friday - no small feat for a location in FiDi. Special shout out to Leland for being extremely cooperative and an absolute pleasure to work with while making the arrangements. We went with the Happy Hour menu and the margaritas were delicious, as were the truffle fries. I'll be looking for opportunities to bring friends and coworkers here- loved it!
